title: About Me
text: pub struct Rumple { pub name: String, pub location: String, pub age: u8, pub hobby: Vec<String>, pub constellation: String, pub m...
content:
pub struct Rumple {
    pub name: String,
    pub location: String,
    pub age: u8,
    pub hobby: Vec<String>,
    pub constellation: String,
    pub mail: String,
    pub motto: String,
}

impl Rumple {
    fn new() -> Rumple {
        Rumple {
            name: "rumple".to_string(),
            location: "Shanghai".to_string(),
            age: 28,
            hobby: vec![
                "Basketball".to_string(),
                "Swim".to_string(),
                "Read".to_string(),
                "Code".to_string(),
                "Games".to_string(),
            ],
            constellation: "Gemini".to_string(),
            mail: "d3JwMzU3NzExNTg5QDE2My5jb20".to_string(),
            motto: "All magic comes with a price".to_string(),
        }
    }

    fn eat(&self) {
        println!("{} eating", self.name);
    }

    fn code(&self) {
        println!("{} coding", self.name);
    }

    fn sleep(&self) {
        println!("{} sleeping", self.name);
    }

    fn life(&self) {
        loop {
            self.eat();
            self.code();
            self.sleep();
        }
    }
}


fn main() {
    Rumple::new().life()
}
package main

import "fmt"

type Rumple struct {
	Name          string   `json:"name,omitempty"`
	Age           uint8    `json:"age,omitempty"`
	Location      string   `json:"location,omitempty"`
	Hobby         []string `json:"hobby,omitempty"`
	Constellation string   `json:"constellation,omitempty"`
	Mail          string   `json:"mail,omitempty"`
	Motto         string   `json:"motto,omitempty"`
}

func NewRumple() *Rumple {
	return &Rumple{
		Name:          "Rumple",
		Age:           28,
		Location:      "Shanghai",
		Hobby:         []string{"Basketball", "Swim", "Read", "Code", "Games"},
		Constellation: "Gemini",
		Mail:          "d3JwMzU3NzExNTg5QDE2My5jb20=",
		Motto:         "All magic comes with a price",
	}
}

func (r *Rumple) Eat() {
	fmt.Println(r.Name, " eating")
}

func (r *Rumple) Sleep() {
	fmt.Println(r.Name, " sleeping")
}

func (r *Rumple) Code() {
	fmt.Println(r.Name, " coding")
}

func (r *Rumple) Life() {
	alive := true

	for alive {
		r.Eat()
		r.Code()
		r.Sleep()
	}

}

func main() {
	NewRumple().Life()
}
class Rumple(object):
  def __init__(self, name: str):
    self.name = name
    self.location = "ShangHai"
    self.age = 28
    self.hobby = ["Basketball","Swim","Read","Code","Games"]
    self.constellation = "Gemini"
    self.mail = "d3JwMzU3NzExNTg5QDE2My5jb20="
    self.motto = "All magic comes with a price"
  
  def eat(self):
    pass

  def code(self):
    pass

  def sleep(self):
    pass

  def life(self):
    alive = True
    while alive:
      self.eat()
      self.code()
      self.sleep()
  

if __name__ == '__main__':
  rumple = Rumple("rumple")
  rumple.life()
